Welcome to my website

Who am I

I am a web designer from Croatia who's been coding since the age of 15. Since then I have made several websites for all sorts of different people, businesses and others. My experience ranges from developing static responsive sites to custom WordPress themes and other CMS driven websites. When working I always try to create a clear message for whom the site is aimed towards. This helps me better understand the needs of my client and how to best fulfil them while still making sure that everything on the website is clear and easy to find. That means when my job is done both the client and I are happy with the outcome.

I have acquired my degree in web design at the "School for graphics, design and media production" and have gone onto study in the UK. During my time there I have expanded my skills in coding and learned how to use other frameworks, and programming languages. When I am not working on a project I'll most likely be spending my time learning new things and polishing the older ones to make sure that when the next project comes up, I am better suited for it and any challenges it may bring.

Featured Work

Programming for web

Go to the website

"Programming for web" was created as a collective of students from the "School for graphics, design and media production" where they would be able to work on real-life projects for other schools and companies as a part of their course.

My role in the creation of this website as the first generation of that collective/group was to manage the overall structure and process of the project as well as manipulating the chosen WordPress theme to fit the design esthetic which was decided.

The website is a simple blog-style site meant to showcase the projects these students worked on and explain in a bit more detail how each project was made and what were some of its challenges.

Radio 808

Go to the website

Radio 808 reached out to the "Programming for web" group of students (which I was apart of), they explained their wants and needs for a redesign of their website and transfer to the WordPress CMS system for their ease of use.

For the website, Radio 808 already had a theme active and they wanted to keep it, so what we did is focused on reshaping that theme to fit their needs and the design choices which they wanted.

My part was to manage the project and make sure that all of the content and the design choices are cohesive. This meant we first needed to come up with the general website design looking at what content will occupy the site and how it should be presented. Once that was determined we split the theme into two groups (design and development).

As a lead developer, my team focused on how to manipulate the WordPress theme to get the desired look, making sure that all of the colours and content was easily editable so that when the design is locked in we can go back and quickly change all of the colour and typography to fit.
